definitions.definition: to join together two or more things; to be joined together
definitions.sensetop: connect A and Bconnect A to Bconnect A with B

examples.text: The towns are connected by train and bus services.
The island is connected to the mainland by a bridge.
The canal was built to connect Sheffield with the Humber estuary.
The rooms on this floor connect.
a connecting door *(= one that connects two rooms)*
A corridor connects his office with the main building.
The canal was built to connect the city with the port.
The two bedrooms connect.
There is a connecting door between the two bedrooms.
There were buses that connected the two villages not only to each other but also with the city.

definitions.definition: to join something to the main supply of electricity, gas, water, etc. or to another piece of equipment

examples.text: We're waiting for the broadband to be connected.
First connect the printer to the computer.
Connect the machine to the power supply.
Downstairs toilets were connected directly to the drains.

definitions.definition: to join a computer or a mobile device to the internet or to a computer network
definitions.sensetop: connect to somethingconnect somethingconnect something to something

examples.text: The device can be hooked up to a mobile phone to connect wirelessly.
Click ‘Continue’ to **connect to the internet**.
My phone keeps refusing to connect to the Wi-Fi.
The system harnesses the processing power of many computers connected by a high-speed network.
Simply connect your device to the camera's Wi-Fi signal.
Many guests leave their laptops **connected to the** hotel **network** when they're not in their rooms.

definitions.definition: to notice or make a link between people, things, events, etc.
definitions.sensetop: connect A and Bconnect A with/to B

examples.text: I was surprised to hear them mentioned together: I had never connected them before.
I found it hard to connect the two ideas in my mind.
There was nothing to connect him with the crime.
He made a statement connecting the terrorist group to the attack.

definitions.definition: to arrive just before another one leaves so that passengers can change from one to the other

examples.text: His flight to Amsterdam connects with an afternoon flight to New York.
There's a connecting flight at noon.

definitions.definition: to put somebody in contact by phone

examples.text: After a long wait I was connected to customer services.

definitions.definition: to form a good relationship with somebody so that you like and understand each other

examples.text: They met a couple of times but they didn't really connect.
The blow connected and she felt a surge of pain.

wordOrigin: late Middle English (in the sense ‘be united physically’; rare before the 18th cent.): from Latin connectere, from con- ‘together’ + nectere ‘bind’.
